title: Principles of Electrodiagnosis
requirements: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Electrodiagnosis is a key technique for the assessment of neuromuscular functioning of the musculoskeletal system, and localizes the level of lesions. In this course, operational principles of equipments will be covered, with optimization of the assessment environment and techniques, principles of electromyography and different forms of nerve conductions and variations.

title: Rehabilitation of the Amputee
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Amputation is a major event in a patient's life. The principles of proper physical therapy to maintain useful function for the amputated limb is covered, together with the principles and types of prosthesis available. This course also covers Alternative management and ambulation for patients who cannot handle prostheses, Phantom pain and sensation management, and Psychosocial issues of amputation.

title: Fitness and Medical Exercise Prescription
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Maintenance of health and body fitness is a universal goal for all. The principles of fitness assessment with emphasis on different age groups are covered. Exercise prescription for different age group is also covered, with demonstration in a gym setting.

title: Principles of Pain Management
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This course focused on Causes, nature and types of musculoskeletal pain, including neuritic pain, neuroma pain, phantom pain, arthritic pain, mechanical back pain, fibromyalgia, bone pain from osteoporosis and bone metastasis, Psychosocial aspects of pain, Survey of medications, and principles of interventional treatment and alternative medicine.

title: Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: Occupation Assessment and Fitness for work
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This is an introduction to the spectrum of musculoskeletal disorders and Rehabilitation issues related to Principle of occupational orthopaedics, background, medicolegal aspects and psychosocial aspect of occupational orthopaedics; Impairment, disability and social standing: assessment and function; Management of specific medical and musculoskeletal problems; Chronic medical condition, Women, children and elderly, musculoskeletal, cognitive impaired patient; Occupation assessment and the work environment; Assessment of work capacity and impairment; Return to work programmes and barriers

title: Current Diagnosis and Management for Musculoskeletal Disorders
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This is an introduction to the current techniques and technologies for diagnosis of musculoskeletal disorders and the principles of management, with coverage over non-operative means, alternative medicine, and also principles of surgical intervention especially for arthritis.

title: Principles of Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This is an introduction to the basic concept of rehabilitation, the relationship between impairment, disability and social participation. Psychosocial aspects of rehabilitation. Techniques and modalities employed by physiotherapy, occupational therapy, prosthetics & orthotics. Community versus institution based rehabilitation.

title: Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: problems and management from an age related perspective
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: An age orientated approach towards common musculoskeletal problems and their rehabilitation, with emphasis on aging related problems such as arthritis, muscle weakness, balance, falls and hip fractures, osteoporosis and back pain and fractures. Problems of childhood and infancy included cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy, scoliosis and other dysplastic limb problems, as well as fracture associated problems. Sports and work related injuries are common among young adulthood and middle age groups, including overuse syndrome, chronic musculoskeletal pain, and body weight issues.

title: Spinal Cord Injury, Amputation & Rehabilitation Technology
components:
Field Studies/Field-trip
Lecture
Seminar
Interactive Tutorial
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Rehabilitation technology is fast developing and finds the most applications in spinal cord injury and amputation for musculoskeletal disorders. Combining the previously independent courses into a single course provides a better integrated delivery of information and application.

title: Pain Management and Psychosocial Aspects of Rehabilitation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Pain in particular chronic pain of the musculoskeletal system is closely linked to psychosocial consequences of disability and proper management is the key to rehabilitation. The new arrangement will provide a holistic approach, and enables participants to explore more deeply the psychosocial issues that arise from musculoskeletal impairments and disabilities and to prepare them for further studies in health counseling or behaviour therapy. In addition the causes, nature and types of musculoskeletal pain are discussed, and introduction to management including the psychosocial interventions, medications, interventional treatments and alternative treatments including chinese medicine.

title: Rehabilitation of Spinal Cord Injury
components:
Field Studies/Field-trip
Lecture
Seminar
Interactive Tutorial
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: A major musculoskeletal problem, the presentations and complications of spinal cord injuries will be studied, covering the different aspects of disabilities. Rehabilitation with an interdisciplinary approach will include the management of ambulation, psychosocial issues, self care, urological and bowel functions, sexuality, with the use of appropriate technologies. Introduction to new research approaches for spinal cord regeneration and functional restoration such as functional electrical stimulation.

title: Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: Special Problems and Management Issues
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Assessment and rehabilitation requirements for different body regions will be covered systemically, highlighting their special requirements. This would include rehabilitation for tendon and nerve injuries in the upper extremities, rehabilitation of ligamental injuries in the lower limbs (especially related to sports injuries), and back rehabilitation. Special issues will cover rehabilitation for joint replacement, major and multiple fractures (e.g. pelvic fractures)

title: Advanced Fitness & Exercise Prescription
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This programme will provide participants more in-depth training in exercise prescription and fitness training, especially related to children with a disability, people with a chronic illness or disability, especially old age people, and to have hands-on experience in supervising fitness training.

title: Rehabilitation Case Seminar
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: In this course participants will have opportunity to present and discuss management of rehabilitation problems with interdisciplinary/ multidisciplinary approaches.

title: Advanced Occupational Orthopaedics and Ergonomics
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Students taking this module are expected to have taken MSMR5121 with satisfactory performance or have prior training and practical experience in occupational orthopaedics to the satisfaction of the programme committee. This module provides students with advanced training in issues related to occupational orthopaedics, basic and applied ergonomics and to prepare them to apply ergonomics in their work, and to become a qualified ergonomic practitioner.

title: Principles and Applied Biomechanics
description: This programme provides participants with fundamental biomechanical principles and application of the principles to the understanding of the basic functioning of the musculoskeletal system. The programme combines lectures with demonstrations and case studies.

title: Clinical Practicum in Musculoskeletal Electrodiagnosis
requirements: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This elective clinical practicum will provide participants with closely supervised handson experience with clinical electrodiagnosis on common disorders.

title: Practicum in Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation I
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This programme provides participants with supervised practical experience in one or more chosen fields of rehabilitation or musculoskeletal medicine, so as to broaden their understanding of the different practices in rehabilitation or musculoskeletal medicine, and to deepen their skills or to acquire new skills. Participants should expect to spend one session per week on their chosen field(s) for roughly 6 months, together with tutorials and assignments to fulfill the programme requirements. Participants will propose a programme that best suit their needs, which will be refined with the help of mentors.The practicum sessions could be coordinated by the programme, or in form of recognition of works in Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation in the existing working position with specific tasks to complete.

title: Practicum in Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation II (Practice Based)
requirements: For students in MSc or Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: Participants who wish to acquire more skills or new skills may take this programme. This programme is a second practicum rotation, and the format is in Practice Based. It is expected the student will focus on one or not more than two fields in order to acquire in-depth understanding of the field(s) or to acquire practical skills.

title: Seminar in Rehabilitation I
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This module may be taken together or separately with MSMR6335. These seminars present one or more current topics of musculoskeletal rehabilitation that may be taken together or separately.

title: Seminar in Rehabilitation II
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: These seminars present one or more current topics of musculoskeletal rehabilitation that may be taken together or separately. The passing requirement is higher.

title: Research Methodology & Biostatistics
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: To provide basic principles of research methodology and biostatistics

title: Topic in Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation I
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This module enables students to undertake relevant courses related to musculoskeletal rehabilitation. They may be taken together or separately with MSMR6502.

title: Musculoskeletal Conference and Workshop I
requirements: For students in MSc or Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This modules enable students to participate in musculoskeletal conferences and workshops to expand their perspectives and understanding in musculoskeletal medicine and rehabilitation.

title: Clinical Centre Attachment I
requirements: For students in MSc or PgD Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This module enable students to gain experience and skills through clinical attachment at recognized hospital unit, clinic, or rehabilitation centre.

title: Dissertation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: The dissertation will be an extended essay of 5000 words on a review of a clinical problem in rehabilitation.

title: Advanced Dissertation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine & Rehabilitation
description: This is a special extended module for eligible students who wish to undertake an extended clinical project that involves the trial of new interventions or comparison of treatment modalities.
